main event: A large yellow ball with a broken tail and a green fringe was spotted by a tower operator at Greenville AFB, Mississippi on June 18, 1960.
interesting points: The object turned bright yellow-white as it approached the horizon where it burned out.
The tower operator stated that this sighting was different from the many meteors he had seen before.
The object was descending at approximately a 75-degree angle.
The object was traveling from east to west.
result: Possibly Balloon, Probably Aircraft, Possibly Astronomical-Meteor, Insufficient Data for Evaluation, Unknown
sighted object: A large yellow ball with a broken tail and a green fringe
witnesses: T/Sgt Roy H. Wubker, tower operator of the 2022-1 AACS Detachment
